SeloSustentavelPremiacao.title: SUSTAINABLE ATTITUDE – IWPPO
SeloSustentavelPremiacao.intro1: Imagine a world where every small action counts. On beaches, in ports, rivers, and even streets, daily decisions shape the future of the oceans. At IWPPO, we believe that good ideas deserve more than recognition — they deserve to set an example. This is how the Sustainable Attitude Seal was born: more than an award, it is a symbol of commitment, creativity, and positive impact.
SeloSustentavelPremiacao.intro2: During the event, participants from different countries and communities are invited to share their stories in videos of up to 3 minutes — showcasing real actions to reduce plastic pollution: from educational campaigns and cleanup efforts to innovative technologies and simple, replicable solutions.
SeloSustentavelPremiacao.network_text: Receiving the seal means joining a global network of change agents. At the end of the event, the winning videos will be shared internationally, inspiring new actions and amplifying the reach of these initiatives. Each winner receives not only recognition but an invitation: to keep acting and inspiring. The ocean begins in our backyard — and caring for it starts with a choice, today.

destaques.title: Clarity and strength of the message
destaques.desc: A well-told, clear, and coherent story. Audio and video quality that supports understanding.

destaques.title: Relevance and originality of ideas
destaques.desc: Alignment with the theme of plastic pollution, supported by data, facts, or real examples. Creative approaches score higher.

destaques.title: Community involvement
destaques.desc: Representation and engagement (number/diversity of participants, inclusion of different groups).

destaques.title: Positive environmental impact (proven or potential)
destaques.desc: Concrete, measurable actions with potential for scalability or lasting impact.

destaques.title: Ability to inspire lasting change
destaques.desc: Videos that mobilize, provoke reflection, and encourage new sustainable attitudes.

SeloSustentavelPremiacao.criterios_intro: Each criterion is scored from 0 to 5. Use the guiding questions to validate your video:

criterios.titulo: 1. Clarity and quality of the message
criterios.desc: The video presents the idea clearly, directly, and coherently, with good audio and video quality.
criterios.perguntas: Is the message easily understood? Is there a coherent narrative?

criterios.desc: Directly addresses the theme of plastic pollution in the oceans, with accurate and contextualized information.
criterios.perguntas: Is the video aligned with the central theme? Does it show data, facts, or real examples?

criterios.desc: Representation and community engagement (number and diversity of participants, inclusion of different social groups).
criterios.perguntas: How many people actively participated? Is there age, gender, or cultural diversity?

criterios.desc: Actions with the potential to generate real and measurable positive environmental impact.
criterios.perguntas: Are the actions concrete and replicable? Do they have scalability or lasting impact?

criterios.desc: Creative use of visual, audio, or narrative resources to convey the message.
criterios.perguntas: Is the video original and engaging? Are there innovative solutions or approaches?

criterios.desc: Ability to motivate the audience to adopt sustainable practices.
criterios.perguntas: Does the video provoke reflection and encourage action?

criterios.desc: Adherence to the 3-minute limit and technical suitability (resolution, framing, editing).
criterios.perguntas: Is the video within the time limit and technically adequate?

escala: 4 = Meets well, with minor adjustments possible
5 = Meets excellently, with no adjustments needed

AboutSection.title: About the Event

section1.heading: II IWPPO 2025
section1.paragraph: The IWPPO was born from the need to discuss and find solutions for one of the greatest environmental challenges of our time: plastic pollution in the oceans. Originating from CEMEIA (Environmental Studies Congress) and supported by CAPES (PAEP Grant) and CNPq, our workshop brings together international experts in an interdisciplinary approach.

section2.heading: Our Approach
section2.paragraph: The workshop combines scientific research, public policies, and technological innovation to address the issue of plastic pollution. With participants from various countries, we promote the exchange of knowledge and practical solutions.

highlights: Endorsed by the UN Executive Committee
Aligned with SDG 14 - Life Below Water

ineditismo.title: Originality
ineditismo.desc: Only original works will be accepted.

modalidades.title: Presentation Formats
modalidades.desc: Participants may present their work in one of the following formats: Oral presentation or E-poster/banner (no physical printing required).

formato.title: Accepted Format
formato.desc: Only extended abstracts will be accepted.

idiomas.title: Accepted Languages
idiomas.desc: Papers can be written in Portuguese, English, or Spanish.

autores.title: Number of Authors/Co-authors
autores.desc: Each work may have up to 6 authors/co-authors (including the lead author).

limites.title: Limit of Works per Participant
limites.desc: Lead author: up to 2 works; Co-author: up to 5 works.

avaliacao.title: Evaluation Criteria
avaliacao.desc: Papers will be evaluated in two stages: (1) preliminary evaluation by the steering committee and (2) evaluation by the Scientific Committee, considering originality, contribution, methodological rigor, writing quality, and relevance to the state of the art.
avaliacao.escala: Very Poor = 1, Poor = 2, Fair = 3, Good = 4, Very Good = 5. Papers with an average score of 4 or higher will be accepted.
avaliacao.resultados: E-poster/banner presentation: 1-hour display (recommended template available on the website). Oral presentation: 10-minute presentation + 5-minute Q&A (recommended template available on the website).

EixosTematicos.envie_trabalho: Submit your work now on Doity

itens.descricao: This thematic track addresses the current state of the oceans in the face of contemporary environmental challenges. It aims to gather studies that assess the health of marine ecosystems, highlighting indicators of environmental degradation, biodiversity loss, acidification, overfishing, and climate change impacts. Research using monitoring tools, ocean modeling, and conservation policy evaluations is also welcome. The goal is to provide a comprehensive and scientific overview of the oceans' condition on local, regional, and global scales.

This track includes research focused on the identification, characterization, and mitigation of pollutants in marine environments, with a special emphasis on emerging contaminants such as microplastics, nanoplastics, pharmaceutical residues, pesticides, and heavy metals. Expected works include studies on sources, dispersion routes, ecotoxicological effects, and potential solutions for these contaminants. Innovative approaches in detection technologies, remediation, and prevention strategies focused on marine sustainability are also included.

itens.titulo: Science with Purpose: Applied Ocean Research
itens.descricao: This track highlights applied science as a strategic tool to address ocean challenges. Research involving remote sensing monitoring, climate modeling, marine biotechnology, and solutions based on emerging technologies such as Artificial Intelligence and Big Data is welcome. The focus is on generating technical knowledge with direct impact on conservation, management, and sustainable use of the seas.

This track addresses the importance of traditional knowledge and the protagonism of coastal communities in ocean preservation. It values interdisciplinary studies on sustainable practices, environmental justice, and the impacts of the climate crisis on the lives of indigenous peoples, artisanal fishers, shellfish gatherers, and riverine communities. It encourages dialogue between science and local knowledge as a strategy for fairer and more effective policies.

This track focuses on disseminating scientific knowledge and strengthening ocean literacy. It includes initiatives for science popularization, production of educational materials, actions in schools and communities, and communication strategies aimed at social mobilization and supporting public policies. Works exploring risk communication in the context of climate crises are also expected.

This track explores the role of public policies in the protection and sustainable management of the oceans. It covers topics such as multilateral agreements, the creation of marine protected areas, national legal instruments, participatory governance, and transparency in coastal management. The track seeks to integrate science, society, and the state to promote effective and equitable ocean governance.

This track promotes innovative approaches for the regeneration and preservation of marine environments. It includes research on coastal ecosystem restoration, ocean renewable energies, blue economy, sustainable production chains, and nature-based technologies. The goal is to encourage solutions that balance socioeconomic development with ecological integrity.

itens.titulo: Oceans and Climate: Interactions and Impacts
itens.descricao: This track analyzes the role of oceans in the global climate system and the effects of climate change on marine and coastal environments. Studies on extreme events, sea level rise, acidification, impacts on vulnerable communities, and mitigation and adaptation strategies are welcome. The emphasis is on understanding and responding to climate risks with a solid scientific basis.

Biagio.palestra: Emergy and Ecological Justice: A new basis for shared responsibility in the oceans
Biagio.biografia: Biagio F. Giannetti holds a PhD and Master’s degree from the University of São Paulo (USP). He began his career at Paulista University (UNIP) in 1992 as an Adjunct Professor and currently holds the position of Full Professor. At UNIP, he coordinated undergraduate programs in chemical engineering and food science (1996-2000) and, since 1998, has been a permanent faculty member in the Graduate Program in Production Engineering (Master’s, Doctoral, and Post-Doctoral levels), as well as leading research activities at the Production and Environment Laboratory (LaProMA). Since 2005, he has been a leader of a research group registered with the CNPq Research Groups Directory. Between 2016 and 2024, he was a Visiting Professor at Beijing Normal University (China) under the National Program for Recruiting High-Level Foreign Experts. He also served as a Visiting Professor at the University of Sonora (Mexico, 2013 and 2019) and the University of Florence (Italy, 2022). Professor Giannetti is the author of over 300 scientific publications, including books, articles, and conference papers, focusing on production and the environment. His Scopus h-index is 37, and his Google Scholar i10-index is 115. He was President of the International Society for the Advancement of Emergy Research (2023–2025) and is currently an Honorary Council Member and Associate Editor of the Journal of Cleaner Production, Associate Editor of Frontiers in Energy Research, and Global Director and founder of the Advances in Cleaner Production Network.

federico-sulis.palestra: Closing the Cycle: Assessing the Sustainability of Cobogós with Marine Plastic Waste
federico-sulis.biografia: Dr. Federico Sulis holds a degree in Natural Sciences from the University of Cagliari (2006), a Master’s in Ecotoxicology from the University of Siena (2011), and a specialization in the design and control of environmental management systems ISO 14001 and EMAS from the Tuscany EMAS ECOLABEL School (2014). He recently completed a PhD in Production Engineering at Paulista University (2023). He has experience in Environmental Sciences, with an emphasis on Production Engineering, focusing on Cleaner Production, Industrial Ecology, Ecotoxicology, Sustainable Development, and Waste Recycling. He is currently a postdoctoral researcher at the Production and Environment Laboratory (LAPROMA) of the Graduate Program in Production Engineering (PPEG) at Paulista University (UNIP), where he conducts research in partnership with the Emergy and Ecosystem Resilience Laboratory (LERE) of the Graduate Program in Environmental Systems Analysis (PPGASA) at Cesmac University Center.

Marcell.palestra: Life cycle assessment and microplastics: an overview
Marcell.biografia: Dr. Marcell Mariano Corrêa Maceno is an Environmental Engineer from the Federal University of Paraná (2007), with a specialization in Quality and Environmental Auditing from the Federal Technological University of Paraná (2010), and a Master’s and PhD in Water Resources and Environmental Engineering from the Federal University of Paraná (2010 and 2015). He is currently an Adjunct Professor IV at UFPR in the Production Engineering program, specializing in environmental management and product design. He coordinates the Graduate Program in Production Engineering (Master’s level) at UFPR, the Brazilian Network for Life Cycle Impact Assessment (RAICV), and is a member of the Advances in Cleaner Production Network (ACPN). Since 2008, he has worked in environmental management and sustainability, with current research focusing on product life cycle assessment, DfX for improving material and energy use, circular economy, sustainability assessment of systems, and product circularity evaluation.

alireza.instituicao: University of the West of England, UK; University of Cape Town, South Africa
alireza.palestra: Recycling plastic pollution into construction solutions for net-zero goals
alireza.biografia: Dr. Alireza Moghayedi is a researcher and educator focused on sustainability, with over 20 years of experience in the Engineering and Built Environment industry. He is a Research Leader in Digital Built Environment at the School of Architecture and Environment at the University of the West of England, Bristol, a Senior Researcher at the University of Johannesburg, and the founder and co-director of S+CUBE at the University of Cape Town. His research focuses on developing inclusive, sustainable, and smart solutions for engineering infrastructure and built environment projects using innovative technologies. He serves as Principal Investigator for several international research projects collectively valued at over £30 million. His work has been published in leading academic journals and conferences and has received numerous awards for research and teaching. Dr. Moghayedi is an accredited project manager and has held various positions in government agencies, engineering consultancies, and construction and development companies worldwide.

barbara-pinheiro.palestra: Frontiers of Science and Policy in Addressing Plastic Pollution
barbara-pinheiro.biografia: Biologist, Master’s, and PhD in Oceanography from UFPE. Researcher at PACTO MAR | UNIFESP | Maré de Ciências. Member of the Executive Secretariat of the Women’s League for the Ocean and the National Committee of the Decade of the Ocean. National Coordinator of Black Women in Ecology, Evolution, and Marine Science.

jemille.palestra: Frontiers of Science and Policy in Addressing Plastic Pollution
jemille.biografia: Marine biologist and PhD in Ecology from UFRJ, she works on interdisciplinary research focused on governance, scientific diplomacy, marine conservation, climate change, and ocean pollution. She is part of the UNESCO Chair for Ocean Sustainability and coordinates initiatives such as the Clean Ocean Network and the COP30 Working Group of the Women’s League for the Ocean. She was the Deputy Coordinator of the O20-G20 and an articulator of the National Plastic-Free Ocean Strategy. She serves as a consultant on socio-environmental impact projects, including the Polen Future Waves Program.

jornalista.palestra: Planet or Plastic? - Stories from journalistic coverage
jornalista.biografia: Award-winning journalist with over two decades of coverage on environmental issues. She sailed from Oiapoque to Chuí for the Sea Without End project. For 10 years, she hosted a radio program at Rádio Eldorado and coordinated socio-environmental projects at the station. For two years, she was a field producer in the Javari Valley for documentary filmmaker Céline Cousteau. She hosts Vozes do Planeta, a pioneering environmental podcast in Brazil with nine years of history, and the Women in Conservation multimedia project. She is a contributor to O Eco, GO Outside, and National Geographic Brazil and a Pulitzer Center fellow. She is also a co-creator of the Women’s League for the Ocean. She is the co-director of the documentary Women in Conservation, awarded at the Female Film Festival 2023, the best environmental film at the Montreal Women Film Festival, and the Toronto International Women Film Festival in 2024, and executive producer of the documentary At the Top of the Amazon in Search of New Species, about USP’s unprecedented expedition to Serra do Imeri, western Amazonas.

vazquez.palestra: Emission pathways of macro- and microplastics to the Pacific Ocean in Peru: detection and quantification
vazquez.biografia: Dr. Ian Vázquez-Rowe graduated in Biology in 2006 from the University of Texas at Arlington. He pursued graduate studies in Environmental Engineering at the University of Santiago de Compostela – USC (2006-2008). In October 2008, he began his research career at USC, where he obtained his PhD in Chemical Engineering in July 2012. From January 2012 to December 2013, Dr. Vázquez-Rowe continued his research career as an R&D Engineer in Environmental Assessment and Management at the Centre de Recherche Public Henri Tudor (now LIST, in Luxembourg). He is currently a Full Professor in the Engineering Department at the Pontifical Catholic University of Peru. He is also an editor for Ocean Resources and Marine Conservation at the International Journal of Life Cycle Assessment. His main research interests are related to environmental management, including life cycle methods, their methodological improvement, and their combination with other methods. Additionally, fisheries and agriculture, food systems in general, and waste and wastewater treatment systems, including plastic emissions to water bodies, have been the focus of his research in recent years. In 2021, he was included in Reuters’ Hot List of the top 1,000 climate scientists worldwide and is annually ranked among the top 2% of researchers globally, according to Stanford University.

clemilson.palestra: Athena Platform: Innovation in the management of Brazilian research and scientific production
clemilson.biografia: Clemilson Marques Batista (CEO). Specialist in graduate program evaluation and higher education public policies, Clemilson Marques Batista has over 25 years of experience in the National Graduate System (SNPG). He worked for eight years in the CAPES Evaluation Directorate, notably in training Vice-Rectors, Coordinators, and technical teams of Graduate Programs nationwide. He also served as an advisor in the Vice-Rector’s Offices of the Methodist Universities of São Paulo (UMESP) and Piracicaba (UNIMEP), where he was responsible for liaising with CAPES, CNPq, and managing the academic secretariat of Stricto Sensu programs. As the founder and director of JANUS EDUCARE, he provided specialized consulting to dozens of public and private universities, including UFRJ, USP, UNB, UPM, UNICAP, UFSC, and FGV, assisting in the creation, reformulation, and evaluation of master’s and doctoral programs, always focusing on CAPES criteria and academic sustainability. He is the creator of the Athena Platform, designed based on his field experience and oriented toward the digital transformation of graduate program evaluation and management. He currently leads the strategic expansion of the Athena project, focusing on partnerships, technological validation, and national and international scalability.

aldilane.palestra: Microplastics in the Human Placenta: Evidence in Alagoas and the International Context
aldilane.biografia: PhD candidate in Materials Sciences (PPGM) with a sandwich period at the University of Hawaii at Manoa (Hawaii, USA), Master’s in Health Sciences (PPGCS), and Bachelor’s in Biological Sciences from the Federal University of Alagoas (UFAL). Member of the Women’s Health and Pregnancy Research Group, part of the Cellular Biology Laboratory/UFAL. She has experience and collaborates on projects in Cellular Biology, Biophysics, Biochemistry, and currently studies the bioaccumulation and effects of microplastics in the human placenta.
